        "__pycache__",
        "node_modules",
        ".git",

    recursiveIgnoreRE = "^(?:LICENSE|README\.[mM][dD])$"
    return name in ignore or test(ignoreRE, name)

def createKwargs(s):
    if not s:
        return {}

    dict = {
        "backup": "dir=pub after=8pm js=1 copy=bu",
        "i": "ignore",
        "budir": "dir=bu",
        "old": "old=1",
        "budir": "dir=bu",
        "pdfjson": "json=1",
        "root": "dir=root",
        "pdf": "pdf=1",
        "5pm": "after=5pm",
        "6pm": "after=6pm",
        "7pm": "after=7pm",
        "8pm": "after=8pm",
        "9pm": "after=9pm",
        "10pm": "after=10pm",
        "11pm": "after=11pm",
        "midnight": "after=12am",
        "noon": "after=12pm",
        "1pm": "after=1pm",
        "2pm": "after=2pm",
        "3pm": "after=3pm",
        "4pm": "after=4pm",
        "pub": "dir=pub",
        "cwf": "dir=cwf",
        "dl": "dir=dl",
        "c": "copy",
        "cp": "copy",
        "debug": "mode=debug",
        "open": "mode=open",
        "o": "mode=open",
        "d": "mode=debug",
        "n": "name",
        "r": "mode=review",
        "today": "date=today",
        "t": "text",
        "ye": "date=yesterday",
        "sm": "small=2000",
        "this": "date=today",
        "tf": "testfunction",
        "mv": "move",
        "of": "onlyFiles=1",
        "h": "html",
        "i": "mode=info",
        "s": "mode=save",
        "big": "big=100000",
    }
    s, quote = mreplace('"(.*?)"', s)
    s = dreplace(s, dict, template="(?<![\w=])(?:$1)\\b")
    regex = "(\S+?) *= *(\S+?)(?= |$)"
    s, items = mreplace(regex, s)
    f = lambda x: int(x) if isNumber(x) else x

    items1 = {k: f(v) for k, v in items}
    items2 = {a: 1 for a in split(s, " ")}
    items1.update(items2)
    if quote:
        items1["text"] = quote[0]
    return items1

text:
def _cleanup_base():
    # cleanup base.py
    # uses globals() to organize everything

    from inspect import getsource

    lib = globals()
    preset = {"pprint": "from pprint import pprint"}

    f = testf("^__", 0, 1)
    keys = filter(list(lib.keys()), f).sort()
    keys.sort()

    def f(key):
        v = lib.get(key)
        t = type(v)
        if t == str:
            s = f"{key} = '{str(v)}'"
            name = "primitives"
        elif t == int or t == float:
            s = f"{key} = {str(v)}"
            name = "primitives"
        elif t == module:
            s = str(v)
            name = search("<module '([\w-]+)'", s)
            if name == key:
                s = f"import {name}"
            else:
                s = f"import {key} as {name}"
            name = "modules"

        elif key in preset:
            name = "modules"
            s = preset[key]
        else:
            s = getsource(v)

        if name:
            pass
        elif test("^_", s):
            name = "apps"
        elif t == type:
            name = "classes"
        elif t == function:
            name = "functions"

        storage.add(name, s)

    storage = Storage()
    map(keys, f)
    items = storage.store.items()
    order = [
        "modules",
        "primitives",
        "functions",
        "classes",
        "apps",
    ]
    rigidSort(items, order, lambda x: x[0])
    s = ""
    for k, v in items:
        v.sort()
        s += join(v)
        s += "\n\n"
    return s
    breaker(3)

def isRemovableFile(file):
    removeRE = "\\bboo\\b|debug|dela|foo|\(|^-?\d+$"
    removeList = ["log", "aux", "mhtml", "tex", "zip"]
    e = getExtension(file)
    size = fsize(file)

    return (
        (e and size < 100)
        or test(removeRE, tail(file))
        or e in removeList
        or e == "js"
        and size < 100
        or size == 0
        or (e == "json" and size < 1000)
    )

text:
def dategetter(s, mode=int):
    today = datetime.today()
    year = today.year
    day = 1
    value = 0

    if s == True:
        value = today.replace(minute=today.minute - 10)
    elif test("^\d", s):
        a, b, c = search('(\d+):?(\d*) *([ap]m)?', s, flags=re.I)
        print(a, b, c)
        offset = 0 if test("am", s, flags=re.I) else 12
        hour = int(a) + offset
        minute = int(b)
        #date = datetime()
        day = (
            today.day - 1
            if today.hour < hour
            else today.day
        )
        value = today.replace(
            day=day, hour=hour, minute=minute, second=0
        )
        #strife = "%A %B %d, %-I:%M:%S%p"
        #print(datestamp(value, strife))
        #return
    elif s == "yesterday":
        value = today.replace(day=today.day - 1)
    elif s == "today":
        value = today
    elif s == "month":
        value = today.replace(day=1)

    return int(value.timestamp()) if mode == int else value

name: jspy
text:
def jspy(lang, key):
    lang = inferlang(lang)

    namePY = "^(?:\w+(?= )|(?<=def |class )\w+)"
    nameJS = (
        "^(?:(?:async )?function|def|class|const) ([\w\$]+)"
    )
    callablePY = "\w\w\w+\.(?!log|toString)[a-z]\w+(?=\()"
    callablePY = "[\w\.]{8,}(?=\()"
    callableJS = (
        "new \w+|\w\w\w+\.(?!log|toString)[a-z]\w+(?=\()"
    )
    # variableJS = '(?:const )?\w+ = (?:.+?[^\[\{](?=\n)|[\w\W]+?\n[\]\}])'
    variableJS = "^(?:const )?\w+ = \w.+"
    cleanupJS = "^(?:const )?\w+ = \w.+"
    cleanupJS = "^\w+(?:\.\w+)*\(.+"
    cleanupPY = "^(?:const )?\w+ = \w.+|^(?:new \w+|\w\w\w+\.(?!log|toString)[a-z]\w+\().+"
    variablePY = "\w+ = (?:.+[^\[\{]|[\w\W]+?\n[\]\}]"
    commentJS = "// "
    commentPY = "# "
    functionJS = "(?:(?<=\n)|^)(?:(?:async )?function|class) \w+\\b[\w\W]+?\n}(?=\n|$)"
    functionJS = "(?:(?<=\n)|^)(?:const [\w\$]+ = [\[\{][\w\W]+?\n[\]\}]|(?:(?:async )?function|class) [\w\$]+\\b[\w\W]+?\n})(?=\n|$)"
    functionPY = (
        "^(?:@.+\n)*(?:def|class) \w+\\b[\w\W]+?(?=\n\S)"
    )

    functionBodyJS = (
        "^(?:(?:async )?function|class) [\w\W]+\n}"
    )
    functionBodyPY = "^(?:def|class) [\w\W]+(?=\n\S+)"

    codeJS = "(?:(?<=\n)|^)(?:(?:(?:async )?function|class) \w+\\b|const \w+ *= *[\[\{])[\w\W]+?\n[\]\}]"
    codePY = "^(?:def|class) [\w\W]+(?=\n\S+)"
    linebreakJS = (
        "/* ------------------------------------- */"
    )
    linebreakPY = "# -------------------------------------"

    indexes = ["js", "py", "vim", "bash", "css", "html"]

    ref = {
        "compiler": ["node", "python3", None, "bash"],
        "runtime": ["node", "python3", None, "bash"],
        "const": ["const ", "", "let"],
        "callableRE": [callableJS, callablePY],
        "nameRE": [nameJS, namePY],
        "functionRE": [functionJS, functionPY],
        "functionBodyRE": [functionBodyJS, functionBodyPY],
        "commentRE": [commentJS, commentPY],
        "superComment": ["//// ", "#### "],
        "//": ['//', '#'],
        "variableRE": [variableJS, variablePY],
        "cleanupRE": [cleanupJS, cleanupPY],
        "codeRE": [codeJS, codePY],
        "linebreak": [linebreakJS, linebreakPY],
        "comment": [commentJS, commentPY],
    }

    value = ref[key][indexes.index(lang)]
    return value

def finder(url, term):
    s = srequest(url)
    templates = [
        "(?:b)>$1</(?:b)",
        "(?:name|value) *= *[\"']$1[\"']",
    ]

    for template in templates:
        r1 = templater(template, term)
        a1 = search(r1, s)
        if a1:
            r = r1.replace(term, "([\w-.]+)")
            m = rf(r, s)
            write("found.json", m, open=1)
            return m

text:
def pdf0901():
    file = "/mnt/chromeos/MyFiles/Downloads/Acing the New SAT Math PDF Book.pdf.json"
    pages = read(file)
    tests = []
    exercises = []

    for i, page in enumerate(pages):
        i = i + 1
        if itest("exercises? (?:-|\\\\u|\u2013)", page):
            exercises.append(i)
        elif itest("chapter\s+\d+\s+practice\s+test", page):
            tests.append(i)

    tests = tests[5:]
    store = []
    count = 0
    length = len(tests)
    i = -1
    answers = []

    while count < length:
        i += 1
        count += 1
        if count == 3:
            count = 0
            try:
                a = tests[i - 2]
                b = tests[i - 1]
                store.extend(list(range(a, b)))
                answers.append(b + 1)
            except Exception as e:
                break

    write(
        "pages.json",
        {
            "exercises": exercises,
            "answers": answers,
            "tests": store,
        },
        open=1,
    )

text:
def createPokemonTemplateComponents(amount=1):
    data = dread("pokemon")
    store = []

    def g(x):
        # local attrs
        attr, value = x.groups(1)
        attrs[attr] = {"default": value}
        return ":" + attr + '="' + attr + '"'

    def f(x):
        # local name
        styleString = (
            ' class="'
            + "pokemon"
            + "-icon\" :style=\"{'width': size + 'px', 'height': size + 'px'}\""
        )
        s = x.group(0)
        s = re.sub(
            ' *(xml).*?".*?"', styleString, s, count=1
        )
        s = re.sub(' *(ver).*?".*?"', "", s, count=1)
        # s = re.sub('(width|height|viewbox).*?"(.*?)"', g, s, count=3, flags=re.I)
        return s

    for n in range(1, amount + 1):

        name = data[n - 1].get("name")
        name = camelCase(name)
        attrs = {
            #'name': {'default': name},
            "size": {"default": "100"},
        }
        s = decode(
            read("pokemon-svg/svg/" + str(n) + ".svg")
        )
        # s = re.sub('[\w\W]+?(?=<g)', '', s, count=1)
        s = re.sub("[\w\W]+?(?=<svg)", "", s, count=1)
        s = re.sub("[\w\W]+?>", f, s, count=1)
        # s = re.sub('</svg>\s*$', '', s, count=1)
        #'template': '<template>' + s + '</template>',
        payload = {
            #'name': name,
            "props": attrs,
            "template": s,
        }
        # s = toVariable(name, payload)
        store.append(payload)

    clip(join(store))

def imageToText(img):
    # sudo apt install tesseract-ocr
    # sudo apt install libtesseract-dev
    # sudo apt install libleptonica-dev pkg-config
    from PIL import Image
    import pytesseract

    return pytesseract.image_to_string(Image.open(img))

    # OR

    # sudo apt install tesseract-ocr
    # sudo apt install libtesseract-dev
    # sudo apt install tesseract-ocr-ita

    # pip install pytesseract
    # pip install opencv

    import cv2
    import argparse
    import os
    import pytesseract
    from PIL import Image

    def extract_text(image):
        im = cv2.imread(image)
        imgray = cv2.cvtColor(im, cv2.COLOR_BGR2GRAY)
        ret, thresh1 = cv2.threshold(
            imgray, 180, 255, cv2.THRESH_BINARY
        )
        filename = "{}.png".format(os.getpid())
        cv2.imwrite(filename, thresh1)
        img = Image.open(filename)
        text = pytesseract.image_to_string(img)
        return text

    if test('^\w+$', s):

def numbered(items, title=''):
    if title: title = '  ' + title + '\n'
    s = '\n' + title + '\n'
    for i, item in enumerate(items):
        spaces = '  ' if i < 9 else ' '
        s += '  ' + str(i + 1) + '.' + spaces + stringify(item) + '\n'
    return s

def buildFiles():
    chdir(dldir)
    changers()
    regex = reWrap(cwtFileDict)
    #files = ff(dldir, hours=40, pdf=1, regex=regex, flags=re.I, antiregex='test.pdf')

    files = [
        "G5 Classwork.pdf",
        "Grade 4 Announcements.pdf",
        "G4 Homework.pdf",
        "G4 Classwork.pdf",
        "Grade 5 Announcements.pdf",
        "G5 Homework.pdf",
        "Student Letters.pdf"
    ]

    storage = Storage()
    misc = []

    for file in files:
        k = search('g(?:rade)? *(\d+)', file, flags=re.I)
        if k and not test('announcement|report', file, flags=re.I):
            storage.add(k, file)
        else:
            misc.append(file)

    data = []
    for k,v in storage.toJSON().items():
        data.append({
            'key': k,
            'files': sort(v, sortCwtFiles),
        })
    prompt({
        'all-files': files,
        'data': data,
        'misc': misc,
        'caller': 'buildFiles',
    })
    return [data, misc, files]

    payload = {
        "subject": getSubject(),
        "files": map(store, lambda x: x.get("name")),
        "attachments": map(store, lambda x: x.get("id")),
        "to": env.workEmail if official else env.EmailContacts.get('self')
    }

    # ------------------------------------------------
    if skipEmail:
        print('Done. Skipping email.')
        return 

    prompt('We always prompt the payload before going to google emails', payload)

    gmailsenturl = "https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#sent"
    ofile(gmailsenturl)
    #clear(departurejsonfile)
    deleteFinishedPDFS()
    if doGrades:
        print("Starting the gradeClassroom auto process.")
        for room in rooms:
            gradeClassroom(room)

        # "Final Exam Review",

        # "Midterm Exam Review",
        # "Midterm Exam",
        # "Handout",
        # "Extra Worksheets",
        # "Quarter 1 Exam",
        # "Announcement",
    ]

    changers = {
        "g5r.pdf": "Grade 5 Final Exam Review.pdf",
        "g4r.pdf": "Grade 4 Final Exam Review.pdf",
        "g5hw.pdf": "Grade 5 Homework.pdf",
        "g4hw.pdf": "Grade 4 Homework.pdf",

        "WG4Q1.pdf": "Grade 4 Quiz.pdf",
        "g4exam.pdf": "Grade 4 Exam.pdf",
        "g5exam.pdf": "Grade 5 Exam.pdf",
    }

    for file, destination in changers.items():
        if isfile(file) and not isRecent(
            destination, days=3
        ):
            mfile(file, destination)

    storage = Storage()

    p1 = "Grade "
    p2 = "G"
    for file in baseFiles:
        file = toPdf(file)
        for grade in grades:
            a = str(grade) + " " + file
            if isRecent(p1 + a, days=3):
                storage.add(grade, p1 + a)
            elif isRecent(p2 + a, days=3):
                storage.add(grade, p2 + a)

    items = storage.toJSON().items()
    classFiles = [
        {"key": str(k), "files": v} for k, v in items
    ]
    extraFiles = filter(map(extraFiles, toPdf), isfile)
    data = {
        "classFiles": classFiles,
        "extraFiles": extraFiles,
    }
    return data

text:
def subprocessRun(s):
    import subprocess
    lines = linegetter(s)
    dprint(lines)
    kwargs = dict(stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, shell=True)
    for line in lines:
        result = subprocess.run(line, **kwargs)
        success = result.stdout.decode()
        error = result.stderr.decode()
        if result.returncode == 0:
            dprint(success)
        else:
            dprint(line)
            dprint(error)
            return

text:
def hashbang(filename):
    assert isfile(filename)
    # Add a hashbang line to the file if it doesn't already have one
    with open(filename, "r") as f:
        first_line = f.readline().strip()

    if not first_line.startswith("#!"):
        print("adding hasbang line")
        with open(filename, "r+") as f:
            content = f.read()
            f.seek(0, 0)
            f.write("#!/usr/bin/env python3\n" + content)

    # Set the execute permission for the file
    os.chmod(filename, 0o755)

def incrementalName(s=0, dir = 'drive'):
    if not s:
        s = prompt('choose a name because s is None')
    override = 0
    if s.endswith('!'):
        s = s[:-1]
        override = 1
    front = removeExtension(s)
    e = getExtension(s)
    d = dirGetter(dir)
    count = 1
    while count < 50:

        if override:
            return name
        if not isfile(name): return name
        count += 1

def chineseMovieJiebaConverter(file, title, breaker=0):
    assert(isfile(file))
    name = camelCase(title)
    outpath = npath('jsondrive', name + '.jieba.json')
    
    dprompt(name, outpath)
    appleBreaker = 'face into\.\.\.'

    s = read(file)

    if breaker:
        s = stringBreaker(s, breaker)
    s = linegetter(s)
    def parser(s):
        x = split(s, ',')
        a = x[1]
        b = x[2]
        c = x[-1]
        c = re.sub(notChineseRE, '', c)
        return jieba.cut(c, timestamp=[a,b])

    items = map2(s, parser)
    payload = {
        'title': title,
        'contents': items,
    }
    write(outpath, payload)

name: parseConversation
text:
def parseConversation(x):
    def parser(item):
        message = item.get('message')
        if not message:
            return 
        author = message.get('author').get('role')
        if author == 'system':
            return 

        timestamp = message.get('create_time')
        id = item.get('id')
        parentId = item.get('parent')
        contentParts = message.get('content').get('parts')
        content = join(contentParts)
        return {
            'author': author,
            'id': id,
            'parentId': parentId,
            'timestamp': timestamp,
            'text': content,
        }

    title = x.get('title')
    id = x.get('id', None)
    timestamp = x.get('create_time', None)
    mapping = x.get('mapping')
    contents = map2(mapping.values(), parser)
    return {
        'title': title,
        'id': id,
        'timestamp': timestamp,
        'contents': contents,
    }

name: iqr
text:
def iqr(data):
    import numpy as np
    q1 = np.percentile(data, 25)
    q3 = np.percentile(data, 75)
    iqr = q3 - q1

    lower_bound = q1 - 1.5 * iqr
    upper_bound = q3 + 1.5 * iqr

    def checkpoint(file):
        return lower_bound <= fsize(file) <= upper_bound

        'bold': bold,

text:
def map(items, fn):
    """
        items (list|dict)
        the fn is always spread for entries and dicts

        it is rather inflexible
        for flexiblity and enumeration, use a comprehension
    """
    double = is_object(items) or is_nested_array(items)
    entries = items.items() if is_object(items) else items
    gn = lambda x: fn(*x) if double else fn(x)

    store = []
    for item in entries:
        try:
            push(store, gn(item))
        except Exception as e:
            kwargs = get_local_kwargs("e, item")
            inform(kwargs, header = "an error has occured")
    return store

text:
def write(file, content, dir = None, ext = None, log = False, ask = 0, openIt = 0):
    """
        the file is normalized with dir and ext if provided
        if content is a str, write as text
        else write as json
    """
    assert content
    filename = normalize_file(file, dir, ext)
    if ask:
        print(content) if is_string(content) else pprint(content)
        if not input("do you wish to write this content?"):
            return

    if is_string(content):
        with open(filename, "w") as f:
            f.write(content)
            print(f"wrote file: {filename}")
    else:
        with open(filename, "w") as f:
            json.dump(content, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

    if log:
        log_file(filename)
    if openIt:
        view(filename)

def force_write(*args, **kwargs):
    """
        fn_degree: 2
        args: [string]
        kwargs: {content?: string}

        the args join together to form the final path
        the text value is kwargs.content or "howdy"

        return: None
    """

    content = kwargs.get("content", "")
    path = Path(*args)
    if not path.parent.is_dir():
        path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=False)

    filename = path.resolve()
    with open(path.resolve(), "w") as f:
        f.write(content)

def days_ago(target_datetime):
    """
    Calculate how many days ago a given datetime was from the current date.

    :param target_datetime: A datetime object representing the past date and time.
    :return: Number of days as an integer.
    """
    current_datetime = datetime.now()
    # print(strftime(dt = current_datetime))
    # print(strftime(dt = target_datetime))
    delta = current_datetime - target_datetime
    return delta.days + 1

name: ordinal
text:
def ordinal(number):
    """
    Convert a number into its ordinal representation.

    :param number: An integer number.
    :return: A string representing the ordinal form of the number.
    """
    if 10 <= number % 100 <= 20:
        suffix = 'th'
    else:
        suffix = {1: 'st', 2: 'nd', 3: 'rd'}.get(number % 10, 'th')

    return f"{number}{suffix}"

name: pluralize_unit
text:
def pluralize_unit(n, unit):
    """
    Return a string with 'day' or 'days' correctly pluralized based on the number.

    :param n: An integer number representing the number of days.
    :return: A string with the number and 'day' or 'days'.
    """
    unit = sub(unit, "s$", "")
    if n == 1:
        return f"{n} {unit}"
    else:
        return f"{n} {unit}s"

text:
def splice(items, start, delete_count=None):
    """
    Removes elements from a list and returns the removed elements.

    :param items: The list from which elements will be removed.
    :param start: The zero-based location in the list from which to start removing elements.
    :param delete_count: The number of elements to remove.
    :return: A list containing the removed elements.
    """
    # Adjust negative start index
    if start < 0:
        start = max(0, start + len(items))

    # Determine the end index for removal
    if delete_count is not None:
        end = start + delete_count
    else:
        end = len(items)

    # Extract the elements to be removed
    removed_elements = items[start:end]

    # Remove the elements from the original list
    items[start:end] = []

    return removed_elements

def get_local_functions():
    module = __import__(__name__)
    names = module.__dict__.keys()
    local_functions = [
        name
        for name in names
        if inspect.isfunction(module.__dict__[name])
        and inspect.getmodule(module.__dict__[name]).__file__
        == module.__file__
    ]
    return local_functions

text:
def create_bookmarks_from_chrome_history():
    """
    the chrome history is retrieved from a chrome extension
    the urls are those that have more than 5 visits
    certain website domains are ignored

    the payload is merged with cached_bookmark_file.
    """
    checkpoint = testf(IGNORABLE_WEBSITE_DOMAINS, anti=1, key="url")

    file = get_most_recent_file(
        filter(absdir(dldir), testf("history.json"))
    )
    data = read_json(file)
    data = filter(data, checkpoint)
    data = filter(data, lambda x: x["visitCount"] > 5)
    data = map(data, lambda x: x["url"])
    data = sort(unique(data))
    new_data = data
    cached_bookmark_file = (
        "~/.cache/kdog3682/frequently_visited_chrome_bookmarks.json"
    )

    def callback(data):
        if data:
            return unique(new_data + data)
        else:
            return new_data

    read_write(cached_bookmark_file, callback)

    index = vim.index

    return path

name: pyvim_plugin_connector
text:
def pyvim_plugin_connector():
    def payload_wrapper(payload):
        print(str_wrap(json.dumps(payload), "~~~"))

    def wrapper(fn, vim):
        payload = {
            "open": 0,
            "error": 0,
            "action": 0,
            "empty": 0,
            "status": 0,
            "success": 0,
            "replace": 0,
            "write": 0,
            "create": 0,
            "build": 0,
            "generate": 0,
            "value": 0,
            "result": 0,
        }

        result = None
        try:
            result = fn(vim)
            payload["success"] = 1
            if is_array(result):
                payload["command"] = pascal_case(result[0])
                payload["args"] = result[1:]
            else:
                payload["args"] = (
                    [result["arg"]]
                    if "arg" in result
                    else result["args"]
                )
                payload["command"] = pascal_case(result["command"])
        except Exception as e:
            result = str(e)
            payload["error"] = 1
            payload["message"] = result

        return payload

    vim = VimState(get_sys_args(1))
    api = __import__("api")
    fn = getattr(api, snake_case(vim.command))
    payload = wrapper(fn, vim)
    payload_wrapper(payload)

name: run_cmd_from_str
text:
def run_cmd_from_str(s):
    funcs = globals()

    def runner(s):
        items = split(s, "\s+")
        fnkey, *args = items

        blue_colon("running command from str", s)
        blue_colon("fnkey", fnkey)
        blue_colon("args", args)

        fn = funcs.get(fnkey)
        args = map(args, to_argument)
        fn(*args)

    items = split(s, "\n\n+")
    item = items[-1]
    runner(item)
    sys_exit("")

def download_folder_within_repository(path, dest):
    if is_dir(dest):
        if confirm(
            f"remove directory {dest} before copying new directory",
            abort=1,
        ):
            rmdir(dest)

    temp_github_dir = "~/GITHUB/temp"
    # if is_dir(temp_github_dir):
    # rmdir(temp_github_dir)

    path = sub(path, "^https://github.com/", "")
    path = sub(path, "tree/master/", "")
    path = sub(path, "(src|public|dist)$", "")
    parts = split(path, "/")
    assert len(parts) == 3
    owner, repo, subdirectory = parts
    url = f"https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}"
    system(f"git clone {url} {temp_github_dir}")
    print("system step complete")
    time.sleep(1)
    path = os.path.join(temp_github_dir, subdirectory)
    prompt(path, dest)
    cp(path, dest)

def increment_path(path):
    path = expand(path)
    base = path
    count = 2
    while os.path.exists(path):
        h = head(path)
        name = remove_extension(tail(path))
        e = get_extension(path)
        path = h + name + str(count) + "." + e
        count += 1
    return path

def download_repository(path, targets=[], dest=None):
    owner, repo = match(path, "github.com/(\S+?)/(\S+?)(?:/|$)")
    outdir = expand(f"~/github/{repo}")
    # if is_dir(outdir):
    # outdir = f" {increment_path(outdir)}"
    # else:
    # outdir = " " + outdir
    # url = f"https://github.com/{owner}/{repo}"
    # if not system(f"git clone {url}{outdir}", mode=bool):
    # return

    if dest:
        if targets:
            target_files = map(targets, lambda x: npath(outdir, x))
            assert every(target_files, os.path.exists)
            map(target_files, lambda x: cp(x, npath(dest, x)))
            printdir(dest)
            return dest
    else:
        filelog(outdir)
        return outdir

name: GetVisualSelection
text:
def GetVisualSelection():
    start_pos = vim.funcs.getpos("'<")
    end_pos = vim.funcs.getpos("'>")

    # Check if selection is on the same line
    if start_pos[1] == end_pos[1]:
        line_num = start_pos[1]
        start_col, end_col = start_pos[2], end_pos[2]

        # Swap if start_col is greater than end_col
        if start_col > end_col:
            start_col, end_col = end_col, start_col

        # Get the line text
        line_text = vim.fn.getline(".")
        visual_selection = line_text[
            start_col - 1 : end_col
        ]  # Adjusting because Python uses 0-based indexing
        return visual_selection
    return ""

name: convert_python_regex
text:
def convert_python_regex(regex):
    count = 0

    def replacer(x):
        nonlocal count
        count += 1
        if is_even(count):
            return ">"
        else:
            return "<"

    regex = sub(regex, "\\\\b", replacer)
    regex = regex.replace("(?:", "%(")
    regex = regex.replace(".*?", ".{-}")
    regex = regex.replace("=", "\\=")
    regex = f"\\v{regex}"
    return regex

def highlight(name, regex, fg=None, bg=None):
    foreground = f"ctermfg = {fg}" if fg else None
    background = f"ctermbg = {bg}" if bg else None
    color_definition_cmd = join(
        flat("highlight", name, foreground, background)
    )
    regex = convert_python_regex(regex)

    execute(color_definition_cmd)
    vim.funcs.matchadd(name, regex)

def replace_word_between_word(confirm=0):
    payload = prompt(f"choose a partial replacement for {word}")
    word = get_word()
    s = get_line()
    c, left, right = get_word_boundaries("\W")
    c, a, b = get_word_boundaries("[-\W_]")
    left_part = s[left : a + 1]
    right_part = s[b:right]
    new_word = left_part + payload + right_part
    execute_replace(word, new_word, confirm=confirm)

text:
def insert_word_between_word(confirm=0):
    payload = prompt("choose a word to insert")
    s = get_line()
    c, a, b = get_word_boundaries("\W")
    before = s[a + 1 : c - 1]
    after = s[c - 1 : b]
    if test(before[-1], "[_-]"):
        payload += before[-1]

    elif test(after[0], "[_-]"):
        payload = after[0] + payload

    new_word = before + payload + after
    execute_replace(get_word(), new_word, confirm=confirm)

mm
text:
def mm(s):
    def callback(s):
        name = match(s, "^function (\w+)")
        return name, s

    r = "^function [\w\W]+?\nend"
    items = findall(s, r, flags=re.M)
    store = reduce(items, callback)

    functions = list(store.values())
    keys = sort(list(store.keys()))

    a = "local M = {}"
    b = "return M"
    exports = map(keys, lambda x: f"M.{x} = {x}")
    return bigjoin(functions, a, exports, b)

def generate_return_statement():
    # a, b = get_line_indexes("block")
    b = get_lnum()
    i = find_line_index("\S", dir=-1, start=b, limit=5)
    start = i
    r = "^ *" + create_var("(\w+)")
    s = get_line(i)
    if not test(s, r):
        return

    store = []
    push(store, match(s, r))
    while True:
        i -= 1
        m = match(get_line(i), r)
        if m:
            push(store, m)
        else:
            break

    payload = str_object_format(store, "object")
    s = f"return {payload}"
    append_block(start, s, auto_indent=1)

def do_dialogue(file):

    roster = read_json("~/projects/hammymath/roster.json")

    """
        this be the main runner
    """
    s = text_getter(file)
    # s = convert_emoji_symbols_to_png(s)

    s, frontmatter = extract_frontmatter(s)
    s = fix_math_symbols(s)
    speakers = frontmatter.get("speakers")

    def get_student(name):
        def finder(ref):
            return ref.get("first_name") == name

        student = find(roster, finder)
        return student.get("full_name")

    frontmatter["students"] = map(speakers, get_student)
    frontmatter["season"] = get_season_and_year()

    d = Dialogue(s, speakers)
    dialogue = d.json()
    return {
        "dialogue": dialogue,
        "meta": frontmatter,
    }

name: mmgg_txt_to_typ
text:
def mmgg_txt_to_typ(s):
    def replacer(x):
        m = len(x.group(0))
        if m == 1:
            return "\n\n"
        else:
            return f"\n\n#v(20pt)\n\n"

    s = trim(s)
    # matches chinese characters

    s = sub(s, "\.", "")
    # fixing stray question marks

    s = sub(s, "\n+(?=[^\s-])", replacer)
    # s = sub(s, "\n+(?=[\u4e00-\u9fa5])", replacer)
    s = sub(s, "\n+-{5,} *\n*", "\n\n#dashbreak()\n\n", flags=re.M)
    return s

def foo(n):
    reversed_atom = reverse(n)
    if len(str(reversed_atom)) != len(str(n)):
        return False

    answer = n * n
    answer_reversed = reverse(answer)
    reversed_atom_squared = reversed_atom * reversed_atom
    if get_last_digit(answer_reversed) == get_last_digit(reversed_atom_squared):
        print(n, answer_reversed, reversed_atom_squared)
        return True
    return False
    if answer_reversed == reversed_atom_squared:
        print(n, answer_reversed, reversed_atom_squared)
        return True

    files = get_files_recursive("~/PYTHON", files = 1, months = 2, size = 1000, private = 1, before = 1, py = 1)
    for file in files:
        s = read(file)
        if len(trim(s)) < 3:
            trash(file)
            continue 
        os.system("clear")
        print(s)
        print("----")
        print(file)
        a = input("press [d] to delete ... [m] to move")
        if a == "d":
            trash(file)

        elif a == "m":
            dest = choose(destinations)
            mv(file, dest)
            pause("press anything to continue")

def mvfiles(files, dir):
    prompt(files, dir)
    mkdir(dir)
    map(files, lambda file: mv(file, dir))
